sen.j: 脇坂 安清（わきさか やすずみ）は、播磨国龍野藩の第3代藩主。
sen.e: Yasuzumi WAKISAKA was the third lord of the Tatsuno domain, Harima Province.
Yasuzumi WAKISAKA was the third lord of the Tatsuno domain of Harima Province.
sen.cmt: , Harima Province を of Harima Provinceに変更
sen.e: Yasuzumi WAKISAKA was the third lord of the Tatsuno domain of Harima Province.
He was the fifth generation of the Wakisaka family, the Tatsuno domain.
He was the fifth generation of the Wakisaka family of the Tatsuno domain.
sen.cmt: , the Tatsuno domain を of the Tatsuno domainに変更
sen.e: He was the fifth generation of the Wakisaka family of the Tatsuno domain.

sen.j: 貞享2年（1685年）8月6日、第2代藩主・安照の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the eldest son of Yasuteru, the second lord of domain, on September 4, 1685.
He was born as the eldest son of Yasuteru, the second lord of the domain, on September 4, 1685.
sen.cmt: of domain を of the domainに変更
sen.e: He was born as the eldest son of Yasuteru, the second lord of the domain, on September 4, 1685.

sen.j: 元禄12年（1699年）12月に叙任し、宝永6年（1709年）11月13日の父の隠居により後を継ぐ。
sen.e: He had appointment in January, 1700 and succeeded to the post due to his father's retirement on December 13, 1709.
He received the appointment in January 1700 and succeeded to the post due to his father's retirement on December 13, 1709.
sen.cmt: had appointmentを received the appointmentに変更。Januaryと1700の間のカンマを削除。
sen.e: He received the appointment in January 1700 and succeeded to the post due to his father's retirement on December 13, 1709.

sen.j: このとき、弟の安利に2000石を分与したため、龍野藩は5万3000石から5万1000石となった。
sen.e: On this occasion, he distributed 2,000 koku (approximately 0.36 million liters of crop yield) to his younger brother Yasuyoshi, so the Tatsuno domain turned to 51,000 koku (approximately 9.18 million liters of crop yield) from 53,000 (approximately 9.54 million liters of crop yield).

On this occasion, he distributed 2,000 koku (approximately 0.36 million liters of crop yield) to his younger brother Yasuyoshi, so the Tatsuno domain turned to 51,000 koku (approximately 9.18 million liters of crop yield) from 53,000 (approximately 9.54 million liters of crop yield).

On this occasion, he distributed 2,000 koku (approximately 0.36 million liters of crop yield) to his younger brother Yasuyoshi, so the Tatsuno domain turned to 51,000 koku (approximately 9.18 million liters of crop yield) from 53,000 (approximately 9.54 million liters of crop yield).

sen.j: 享保7年（1722年）2月9日、父に先立って38歳で死去し、後を三男・安興が継いだ。
sen.e: He died at the age of 38 before his father on March 25, 1722 and his successor was his third son Yasuoki.
He died at the age of 38 before his father on March 25, 1722 and his successor was his third son Yasuoki.
He died at the age of 38 before his father on March 25, 1722 and his successor was his third son Yasuoki.
Grave: Seigen-ji Temple in Aoyama.
Grave: Seigen-ji Temple in Aoyama.
Grave: Seigen-ji Temple in Aoyama.

sen.j: 京都府京都市右京区花園の妙心寺隣花院。
sen.e: Rinka-in, Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Rinka-in, Myoshin-ji Temple in Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
